Docs.summary: The interface that must be implemented in the host application to handle the event that occurs when a form is loaded in the object, which is hosted in a custom application.

remarks.para: The method of the _IInitEventHandler interface is where custom code should be located to handle the initialization of a form.

The _IInitEventHandler interface is available for use when the InfoPathEditor object is hosted in a custom application. For more information about the InfoPathEditor and the objects , see the MSDN article Hosting the InfoPath 2007 Form Editing Environment in a Custom Windows Form ApplicationWhat's New for InfoPath Developers.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InitEventHandler (object punkSender, Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath._XDocument pDocument, out Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.XdReadOnlyViewMode pROMode);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InitEventHandler([in]object punkSender, [in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath._XDocument pDocument, [out] valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.XdReadOnlyViewMode& pROMode) runtime managed
Public Sub InitEventHandler (punkSender As Object, pDocument As _XDocument, ByRef pROMode As XdReadOnlyViewMode)

public: void InitEventHandler(System::Object ^ punkSender, Microsoft::Office::Interop::InfoPath::_XDocument ^ pDocument, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] Microsoft::Office::Interop::InfoPath::XdReadOnlyViewMode % pROMode);
abstract member InitEventHandler : obj * Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath._XDocument * XdReadOnlyViewMode -> unit

Docs.param: A pointer to the source of the event.
A reference to the object loaded into the InfoPathEditor object.
An enumeration that specifies how the view of the form will be presented.
Docs.summary: Handles the initialization event when a form is loaded in the hosted object.

remarks.para: InitEventHandler method executes after all auxiliary DOMs are loaded but before the event occurs.

The InitEventHandler method is available for use when the InfoPathEditor object is hosted in a custom application. For more information about the InfoPathEditor and the objects , see the MSDN article Hosting the InfoPath 2007 Form Editing Environment in a Custom Windows Form ApplicationWhat's New for InfoPath Developers.
